properties.Title: Update To Civil Emergency Alert Issued By Government Of Saskatchewan
properties.Summary:
Description: Update for the Civil Emergency Alert issued by the Government of Saskatchewan. The state of emergency in Saskatchewan remains in effect. UPDATE: Phase 1 of Re-Open Saskatchewan became effective May 4, 2020. All Public Health Orders continue to apply during the implementation of Phase 1 Re-Open Saskatchewan. Continue to monitor and follow all public health orders on the Saskatchewan.ca COVID 19 website. Continue to practice physical distancing. Avoid gatherings with people outside your immediate household. Avoid unnecessary travel. Self-isolate if returning from foreign travel or if experiencing any symptoms. Wash your hands often. Together, we are reducing the risk. We can pull together by staying apart.
Expires: 2020-05-19T17:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre, 2020-05-18T10:33:55-06:00, 6A87316A-3D60-F601-9279-56EE81BCD10F
Area: Province of Saskatchewan
properties.Author: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Minimum temperatures: near zero. Locations: northern and eastern Nova Scotia. Time span: overnight and early Monday morning, and again on Tuesday morning. Remarks: Frost is expected to form tonight as clearing skies and light winds coincide with cool temperatures, especially in low lying areas. Frost conditions are expected to be met Monday night into Tuesday morning as well. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-18T17:46:54-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-18T01:47:54-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3170524964.2020
Area: Cumberland County - Minas Shore, Cumberland County North and Cobequid Pass, Colchester County - Cobequid Bay, Colchester County North, Colchester County - Truro and south, Halifax County - east of Porters Lake, Pictou County, Guysborough County, Antigonish County, Richmond County, Inverness County - south of Mabou, Inverness County - Mabou and north, Victoria County, Sydney Metro and Cape Breton County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Potential for heavy rainfall continues through Monday morning 5 to 15 mm of rainfall has fallen across the southern interior since early this morning, A moist and unstable atmosphere over the southern BC interior tonight will continue to provide favourable conditions for showers and thunderstorms. The possibility of locally heavy downpours will continue through Monday morning. Further rainfall amounts of 5 to 15 mm are expected tonight. High streamflow advisories are currently in effect for these regions of the BC interior. They can be found at: http://bcrfc.env.gov.bc.ca/warnings/index.htm . ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-18T17:27:07-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-18T01:28:07-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3012548491.2020
Area: Fraser Canyon - north including Lillooet, Fraser Canyon - south including Lytton, South Thompson, Nicola, North Okanagan - including Vernon, Central Okanagan - including Kelowna, South Okanagan - including Penticton, Arrow Lakes - Slocan Lake, Boundary, West Kootenay
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A wet, cool, and windy Victoria Day for the GTA. Rain is expected to develop across the GTA this evening and continue through the holiday Monday before tapering off Monday night. Total rainfall amounts of 25 to 40 mm are expected with the potential for 50 mm over portions of the western GTA. Cool easterly winds will keep temperatures in the 10 to 12 degree range Monday. This is well below below the normal high of 20 degrees for this time of year. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-18T16:50:58-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-18T00:51:58-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3463662828.2020
Area: City of Toronto, Vaughan - Richmond Hill - Markham, Caledon, Mississauga - Brampton, Halton Hills - Milton, Burlington - Oakville
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant rainfall will continue today. Rain is expected to continue today with additional amounts of 15 to 25 millimetres. The rain will taper off this evening in most places. However, in areas near the Michigan border, rain may persist into Tuesday with additional rainfall amounts possible. Environment Canada will continue to monitor the situation closely. Rainfall Warnings may be issued if higher rainfall amounts appear likely. For information concerning flooding, please consult your local Conservation Authority or Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources and Forestry District office. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-19T00:39:11-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-18T08:40:11-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3150380550.2020
Area: Watford - Pinery Park - Eastern Lambton County, Sarnia - Petrolia - Western Lambton County, Chatham-Kent - Rondeau Park, Windsor - Leamington - Essex County, London - Parkhill - Eastern Middlesex County, Strathroy - Komoka - Western Middlesex County, Saugeen Shores - Kincardine - Southern Bruce County, Hanover - Dundalk - Southern Grey County, Wingham - Blyth - Northern Huron County, Listowel - Milverton - Northern Perth County, Goderich - Bluewater - Southern Huron County, Stratford - Mitchell - Southern Perth County, Mount Forest - Arthur - Northern Wellington County, Guelph - Erin - Southern Wellington County, Kitchener - Cambridge - Region of Waterloo, Shelburne - Mansfield - Northern Dufferin County, Orangeville - Grand Valley - Southern Dufferin County

properties.Title: Freezing Rain Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant ice build-up due to a long-lasting period of freezing rain is expected or occurring. A prolonged period of freezing rain will continue today, through Monday night and into Tuesday for Brochet, Tadoule Lake and Churchill. Freezing rain began in Churchill overnight and will persist through the day. Although temperatures will climb towards freezing today, a persistent northeasterly wind off of Hudson Bay will likely keep precipitation as freezing rain through the day. The precipitation will ease through Monday night. Freezing rain accumulations in Churchill could reach as high as 10 to 15 mm. Southern areas of the Tadoule Lake region may see freezing rain accumulations of 15 to 25 mm before the area of freezing rain moves north this evening. In the Tadoule Lake townsite, the freezing rain will occur mainly this evening into Tuesday morning with 5 to 10 mm accumulation. The extent of freezing rain will be limited in Brochet due to milder temperatures and lighter precipitation. Freezing rain developed over the southeastern corner of the region overnight and will push northwards today with accumulations of 2 to 5 mm by Tuesday morning. The location and intensity of freezing rain will be sensitive to the exact track of this system as well as small changes in temperature. Stay alert for updated bulletins and check the public forecast for additional details on timing. ### Freezing rain warnings are issued when rain falling in sub-zero temperatures creates ice build-up and icy surfaces. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-19T01:37:27-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-18T09:38:27-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1716143057.2020
Area: Brochet, Tadoule Lake, Churchill
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Update-Wildfire Emergency Advisory Alert Is Being Issued By The Rm Of Torch River #488
properties.Summary:
Description: Update for the wildfire emergency advisory alert is being issued by the RM of Torch River #488, due to wildfire that has serious potential to cause emergency situations to the public. The wildfire is currently burning along the southwest edge of the RM of Torch River, from range road 2185 west to range road #2220, not along the north west edge of the RM of Torch River #488 Potential for heavy smoke in the communities of Smeaton, Snowden and Shipman.

properties.Title: Winter Storm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A winter storm will move from the Canadian Prairies into Hudson Bay on Tuesday, spreading heavy snow and freezing rain along coastal regions of the Kivalliq to Southampton Island. There is still some uncertainty with this system, however early indications are that snow, followed by a significant freezing rain event is possible for Arviat. North of the band of freezing rain, moderate to heavy snow will develop with accumulations of 10 to 15 cm possible by Wednesday morning for Whale Cove, Rankin Inlet, Chesterfield Inlet and Coral Harbour. Stay alert for revised bulletins as this system is still developing and regions may be added or warnings may be issued closer to the event. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-19T00:22:58-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-18T08:23:58-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2361294182.2020
Area: Arviat, Rankin Region including Whale Cove, Chesterfield Inlet, Coral Harbour
properties.Author: Environment Canada
